album.title: It's Dark And Hell Is Hot

wiki.content:
Ruff Ryders' Anthem is the fourth and final single by DMX from his debut studio album It's Dark and Hell Is Hot and produced by popular hip hop producer Swizz Beatz. The song is usually known as one of DMX's best known singles in his career and it was one of the singles for his debut album. Instrumentally, it was famous for the catchy trumpet sound. Also the song is known for DMX's singing on the chorus: "Oh, no/That's how ruff ryders roll". "Ruff Ryders' Anthem" lyrics is basically addressing "ruff ryders" procedures. 
 
 The song was also a released as a B-Side to "Slippin'". It ranks at #79 on VH1's 100 Greatest Songs of Hip Hop. In the U.S. it peaked at #94 on the Billboard Hot 100.
        
User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License and may also be available under the GNU FDL.
